intro: Rhododendron pilicalyx, commonly known as the Himalayan rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in Nepal and Bhutan. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and moist environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually pink or red, blooming in late spring. Rhododendron pilicalyx is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and ecologically significant plants. Its growth habit and floral characteristics make it a notable species in alpine ecosystems.
